runs.comm: touch of swing straight away, dipping back to the batsman and a massive appeal given not out
touch of swing again, clips the front pad and thuds away for a leg bye to get Pakistan's innings off
swing here again but absolutely no pace off the wicket. Started wide, went wider, but outside off stump so left alone
lovely delivery, full, drawing a loose-limbed and airy drive, but swinging past the edge
fortunate for Farhat, another flat-footed loose drive outside off, finds a thick edge past the second slip for a boundary
good finish to a good over, Sidebottom, who's sporting the sort of stubble which makes him look like he's been out there for weeks, finds swing yet again and it's left alone outside off
very gentle start from Bresnan, no movement and no pace, but a tidy enough line outside off and left alone
more intent here from Nazir, shuffling down the wicket but Bresnan pulls back his length and it's defended
slightly short and outside off, Nazir heaves at it and misses. Ugly shot to a bad ball
good line and length, neatly defended
good delivery this, fuller, bang on line, and nothing there for the batsman to attack
a touch of width, allows a back-footed force to Pietersen at mid off, they scamper through for a single
bit of grubber this, pitches and creeps along the ground, below an attempted flick shot, through to Prior
nicely bowled, shaping back at Nazir who shovels it into the leg side for a single
much fuller this time, Farhat tries to flick it into the midwicket region but misses and it crashes into his pads
lovely shot for a single, taken from a back of a length outside off stump and cut wristily down to third man
Nazir wanders down the wicket again, tries to heave this back over Sidebottom but finds no timing and the bowler fields
ooh, good ball. Zipping bouncer that the batsman has to quickly evade. Clearly Sidebottom didn't like the batsman advancing down the wicket at him the ball before
a hint of movement back into the left hander, worked away for a single to square leg
well, Twenty20 is of course not a textbook game, but that was a truly hideous heave. Swung himself off his feet and found nothing but thin air
another wild looking leg-side thwack, on to the batsman too quickly and he can't get it away

well, third time unlucky. Another shortish ball, another ugly swipe, finds the top edge and sails comfortably to Denly at deep square-leg. The bowling change worked and Nazir seemed to get frustrated very quickly.
back of length, calmly defended down the pitch
well, what have we here? An attempted Dill-Scoop. Doesn't get enough of it and ends up guiding it, one bounce to Prior
change of bowling again, and tight line and length prevents any chance of the batsman attacking
nicely played, short ball and Latif rocks back and pulls in front of square
lovely shot this, walked inside the line and flicked it past the short fine leg for four
another one! Fuller delivery this time and Farhat flicked handsomely for boundary to deep square
oh dear, almost a mix up here, Farhat guides it to midwicket and sets off for a single before changing his mind and scampering back

well, it looked like an easy single, as it was pushed off the back foot to Pietersen, who swiftly fielded and under-armed it on to the stumps at the non-strikers end. Very smart work from Pietersen, seemed to surprise everyone
good tight lines and length, can't get it away. England right on top here.
back of a length, and defended back to the bowler
Umar is away, waiting on the back foot, takes this off his hip to fine leg for a couple
plenty of bounce here, in fact, too much, it sails well over the batsman's head for a wide
persisting with a back-of-a-length approach, and it's calmly blocked to point
shortish again, taken off his hip to square leg for a single
changes the length nicely here, a touch fuller, neatly worked into the square-leg region
bustles up and delivers an absolute shocker. No-ball, and well wide outside off. Free hit time!
well, tried to smack this full length ball all the way to Lahore, finds absolutely no timing and it trickles back to the bowler
Wright strikes! And the bowling change has worked again. Fullish ball and Latif has a firm-footed swish outside off stump and edges it through to Prior
nicely timed for no run. Hanging back he throws his arms through the line of the ball, straight to the cover fielder
another tight single, driven into the covers, Collingwood fields and throws down the stumps, much to the excitement of all the England fielders but he was home safely
slightly too much width allows a back cut, but it goes to third man for just a single
Pakistan can't get away it seems, good tight bowling and Malik defends
good bowling again, probing outside off stump and it is defended
back of a length and zipping quickly up at Umar Akmal, on too quickly for him and finds a top edge that loops over Prior
not that short but Akmal is hanging back and swipes effectively into the deep midwicket region for a couple
plays this nicely into the covers for one
neatly dabbed from off stump down to third man, no boundaries, but at least the strike is turning over
unlucky for Bresnan, pitches a good yorker but it's squeezed out by Akmal down to third man, Sidebottom hurls himself across the turf with no elegance at all, and can't save a much-needed boundary
good start, full, just outside off driven to mid off
full again, driven firmly and correctly down the ground where long off fields

oh great catch! Swann strikes and Umar has gone! Just outside off stump, Umar flashes a cut and Broad flies from short-third man to his left and plucks it out of the air at full stretch. Swann the first-over king strikes again in his first over
nicely flighted, looping at the left hander who defends
shorter and quicker this time, cut into the off side for a single
very delicate from Malik, waited on it and guides it down to third man from a slightly quicker ball outside off stump
worked away into the leg side
bustles up like an enthusiastic puppy, I really can't get that image out of my head, and bowls a good, shortish ball on off stump that is defended back to the bowler
good shot, shortish again and gets quite high, but pulled down nicely in front of square where only some athletic, sliding fielding by Denly at deep midwicket saves a boundary
clipped away for a single but Pakistan will want some boundaries
lucky here for the batsman, or unlucky for the bowler, or both. Outside off stump, big swish finds the inside edge and flashes past the stumps down to fine leg
good finish from Wright, tight on the stumps and no run
lovely shot, good use of the feet and chipped away of deep midwicket for a welcome boundary
driven along the ground down to long off
round the wicket, angled in to middle and leg, dropped out into the off side and a comfortable single on offer
offered width outside off and it's dabbed away down through short third man...wrong line from Swann on this occasion
uses his feet and pushes into the gap on the off side
opens the face and pushed into the covers
brilliant fielding from Collingwood at cover as Alam laces a cover drive but the England (Twenty20) captain plucks off the save with one hand and almost produces a run out
width outside off, slashed away hard over backward point but can't find the boundary as the sweeper cuts it off
worked out to midwicket, better line on middle and leg to cramp the batsman
lack of pace in the pitch causing problems again as he tries to drive but gets no timing on the shot and loses control of the bat...ball dribbles into the leg side
forced through the off side, stood tall and found the gap at cover out to the deep fielder
driven down the ground to long off...runs ticking over, but not many boundaries
outside off, driven firmly but straight to cover
pushed down the ground to long off...how long do Pakistan wait before opening up?

that's the shot of the day so far, an effortless pick-up from leg stump by Alam and the ball flies over deep square-leg for the first six of the match...he would have been worried for a moment, but it evaded Trott on the rope
worked through the leg side
off cutter from Collingwood, Malik can't beat backward point as he picks out Pietersen
taken from outside off and flicked down to long on...decent over for Pakistan
dragged down a touch from Wright, but a lack of bounce means Malik can't get hold of it and picks out midwicket
short ball, top edge, but Malik gets away with it as the ball lands between two fielders - short fine-leg and deep square-leg - to the relief of the batsman and frustration of the bowler
jabbed down to third man from outside off
low full toss, comes off the bottom of the bat and Alam gets a single to deep cover
that's a wonderful shot, it almost took out the non-striker as Malik drilled a drive straight down the ground and long on had no chance of stopping it...Alam ended up flat on the ground
beautiful batting, steps across outside off and flicks this delivery down through short fine-leg...Wright had adjusted his line, but Malik adjusted his shot even better.
round the wicket, pushed into the covers and even Collingwood can't stop the single
another one goes, and Swann strikes in the first over of a spell again, as Malik chips limply to midwicket to bring a soft end to a promising innings
placed square on the off side to open his account
another single into the off side
beaten outside off as he tries to cut this one through third man...slightly quicker from Swann
guided straight to short third-man, but the fielder is deep enough to allow an easy single
back of a length, angled away to third man
short, heaved away, but no timing and it goes straight to midwicket inside the circle
connects better with this one, another short ball and clubbed through midwicket but straight to the deep fielder
jeepers, nearly chops this one on with a bottom edge but the ball bounces over the stumps
there's Razzaq, and there's a six...back of a length, Razzaq clears his left side and smashes this flat over midwicket straight into the advertising boards...what a clean strike

has he gone this time? Nope, he's safe as a huge top edge that when high into the night sky dropped between two boundary fielders from midwicket and mid on running in...gee, I think that nearly hit the moon
slower ball, worked down to long on just to give Razzaq the strike
excellent slower ball, loops off the surface and completely beats Razzaq's attempted pull
heaved along the ground through midwicket, they think of two but it's just a single
clipped off leg stump out to deep square-leg
dropped Eoin Morgan at deep midwicket has spilled one, it came flat and fast as Razzaq pulled a short ball, Morgan dived forward and couldn't hold on...that may be crucial
full outside off, driven hard through the covers to keep the strike
hint of width outside off, cut away through the off side
full outside off, just another single out to backward point...England won't mind ones at this stage
gone, Broad gets another wicket with a short ball as Alam gets a thin top edge through to Prior...he'd played a useful hand, but England keep chipping away
cramps the new batsman for room on middle and off, can only defend back down the pitch...excellent stuff from Broad
opens the face and runs down to third man
cracking shot, power and placement from Razzaq as he gives himself room outside leg stump to drive this over cover and it easily beats the sweeper
lovely stuff from Sarfraz, he has the confidence to go down on one knee and sweep the pace bowler - it was 83mph - past short fine-leg...that takes balls, and skill
he tries it again, but doesn't make contact on this occasion
a wicket with a short, wide ball that hardly deserved it, but that's Twenty20...Sarfraz saw width and guided it straight to third man as though giving catching practice
leg-stump yorker, Razzaq does well to place this just wide of long off...can Razzaq add another 20 to this total?
full again, thumped straight down the ground and just past Bresnan who didn't really know much about it...long off scampers around
well, England's planning is certainly working tonight, another slower-ball short delivery, Razzaq backs away and tries to guide it past third man but Broad dives forward and takes another good catch
beaten by another slower ball outside off...England have shown how to bowl on this surface
top shot, full and driven straight down the ground with perfect placement to bisect long off and long on...much-needed for Pakistan
goes short again, a bottom edge rolls past the keeper
swing and a miss outside off...strike one for Gul, it was another slower ball from Sidebottom
short and pulled away out to deep midwicket
it's a boundary, good away for Pakistan to finish as he backs away and places a short ball between the backward point and short third man
